docs.summary: Describes the Local Delivery integration to be called by Wix and received by the relevant registered local delivery provider third-party. This integration is used to get a delivery estimate or to create a delivery. Here we describe the endpoints you need to implement in your app.
Retrieves the delivery vendor business status

permissions.name: Manage Orders
permissions.description: Request permission to read and update site's Wix Restaurants orders.

params.name: storeLocationId
params.doc: Unique identifier of the specific store that the delivery is for.

params.name: pickupBusinessName
params.doc: The name of the business where the order should be picked up from.

params.name: pickupPhoneNumber
params.doc: Phone number of the store where the order should be picked up from.

params.name: pickupInstructions
params.doc: Instructions for the courier at the pickup location.

params.name: dropoffInstructions
params.doc: Instructions for the courier at the dropoff location.

params.name: orderTotal
params.doc: The subtotal for all items in the order, excluding tax/tip.

params.name: orderTip
params.doc: Amount that will be paid to the courier.

extra.description: The data payload will include the following object as an encoded JWT. For the purposes of this example, we show the request and response objects decoded.

examples.title: Create delivery with a dropoff time - decoded JWT

extra.description: The data payload will include the following object as an encoded JWT. For the purposes of this example, we show the request and response objects decoded.

params.name: pickupInfo
params.doc: Info for creating a pickup delivery. Can also be specified for drop-off orders, so that the deliverer knows where to pick up the order before dropping it off.

params.name: dropOffInfo
params.doc: Info for creating a drop-off delivery. Can also be specified for pickup orders, so that the deliverer knows where to drop off the order after picking it up.

params.name: contactlessDelivery
params.doc: If `true`, the delivery is a contactless delivery. This means that the order is placed outside the customer's door.

docs.summary:
This endpoint creates an order for a delivery. 

 Wix calls this endpoint when 
 a customer requests a delivery on the merchant's Wix site.

 > You cannot try out this endpoint because it has to be implemented by 
 > an app and can have an arbitrary URL. So please ignore the **Authorization** 
 > and **POST** sections below as well as the **Try It Out** button.

params.doc: Unique identifier of the specific store that the delivery is for.

params.name: orderTotal
params.doc: The subtotal for all items in the order, excluding tax/tip.

docs.summary: Retrieves an estimate of the delivery

This endpoint retrieves the status of an account with the local delivery 
 service provider from your app. The status determines if delivery operations are allowed, 
 such as getting an estimate or ordering a delivery.

 Wix calls this endpoint, for example, when the Delivery Area dashboard page 
 is loaded.
 
 > You cannot try out this endpoint because it has to be implemented by 
 > an app and can have an arbitrary URL. So please ignore the **Authorization** 
 > and **POST** sections below as well as the **Try It Out** button.

examples.title: Get account status - decoded JWT

extra.description: The data payload will include the following object as an encoded JWT. For the purposes of this example, we show the request and response objects decoded.

params.name: pickupAddress
params.doc: Delivery pickup address. Can also be specified for drop-off orders, so that the deliverer knows where to pick up the order before dropping it off.

params.name: dropOffAddress
params.doc: Delivery drop-off address. Can also be specified for pickup orders, so that the deliverer knows where to drop off the order after picking it up.

params.name: configurationId
params.doc: Unique identifier for the store, restaurant, or business where the order originated from.

docs.summary:
This endpoint retrieves an estimate for a delivery from your app, including the delivery fee 
 and when the local delivery service provider can dispatch the delivery.

 Wix calls this endpoint when a customer enters their delivery address, 
 and again when the order is accepted by the site owner.
 
 > You cannot try out this endpoint because it has to be implemented by 
 > an app and can have an arbitrary URL. So please ignore the **Authorization** 
 > and **POST** sections below as well as the **Try It Out** button.

examples.title: Get delivery estimate with pickup time - decoded JWT

extra.description: The data payload will include the following object as an encoded JWT. For the purposes of this example, we show the request and response objects decoded.

examples.title: Get delivery estimate with dropoff time - decoded JWT

extra.description: The data payload will include the following object as an encoded JWT. For the purposes of this example, we show the request and response objects decoded.

docs.summary: Retrieves list of account belongs to given instance

examples.title: List account ids - decoded JWT

extra.description: The data payload will include the following object as an encoded JWT. For the purposes of this example, we show the request and response objects decoded.

docs.summary:
The endpoint retrieves a list of account IDs for a merchant's store, restaurant, or 
 business (instance) using your app.

 Wix calls this endpoint, for example, when the Delivery Area dashboard page is loaded.
 
 Each account ID in the response represents an account between the store, restaurant, or business (instance) 
 and the local delivery serice provider.
 These IDs are used to check if the 
 accounts are operational (active) using the `Get Account Status` endpoint.
 
 >**Notes**:
 > + For now, Wix supports one account per merchant. In the future, we will support 
 >   multiple accounts, such as one account per location. For example, “TallOrders NY” 
 >   could have an account with a local delivery service provider in NY and 
 >   “TallOrders CA” could have an account with a different service provider.
 > + You cannot try out this endpoint because it has to be implemented by 
 >   an app and can have an arbitrary URL. So please ignore the **Authorization** 
 >   and **POST** sections below as well as the **Try It Out** button.

examples.title: List account ids - decoded JWT

extra.description: The data payload will include the following object as an encoded JWT. For the purposes of this example, we show the request and response objects decoded.

members.name: subdivision
members.doc: Subdivision. Usually a state, region, prefecture, or province code, according to [ISO 3166-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-2).

members.name: addressLine2
members.doc: Free text providing more detailed address info. Usually contains Apt, Suite, and Floor.

docs.summary:
Money.
 Default format to use. Sufficiently compliant with majority of standards: w3c, ISO 4217, ISO 20022, ISO 8583:2003.

members.name: value
members.doc: Monetary amount. Decimal string with a period as a decimal separator (e.g., 3.99). Optionally, a single (-), to indicate that the amount is negative.

members.name: currency
members.doc: Currency code. Must be valid ISO 4217 currency code (e.g., USD).

members.name: formattedValue
members.doc: Monetary amount. Decimal string in local format (e.g., 1 000,30). Optionally, a single (-), to indicate that the amount is negative.

members.name: id
members.doc: Optional. Used as reference to the estimate when creating a new order

members.name: pickupWindowStartTime
members.doc: Status of the order creation call

members.name: pickupTime
members.doc: The requested time at which the order should be picked up.

members.name: dropoffTime
members.doc: The requested time at which the order should be delivered.

members.name: pickupWindowStartTime
members.doc: When a delivery is ready to be picked up. This is the start of the pickup window.

members.name: pickupWindowEndTime
members.doc: When a delivery must be picked up by. This is the end of the pickup window.

members.name: dropoffWindowStartTime
members.doc: When a delivery is ready to be dropped off. This is the start of the dropoff window.

members.name: dropoffWindowEndTime
members.doc: When a delivery must be dropped off by. This is the end of the dropoff window.

members.name: fee
members.doc: Amount that is charged for this delivery.

members.name: status
members.doc: Status of the account with the local delivery service provider.

members.name: pickupAddress
members.doc: Delivery pickup address. Can also be specified for drop-off orders, so that the deliverer knows where to pick up the order before dropping it off.

members.name: dropOffAddress
members.doc: Delivery drop-off address. Can also be specified for pickup orders, so that the deliverer knows where to drop off the order after picking it up.

members.name: configurationId
members.doc: Unique identifier for the store, restaurant, or business where the order originated from.

members.name: estimate
members.doc: The estimate, which includes the delivery fee and estimated pickup and drop-off times.

members.name: subtotal
members.doc: The subtotal for all items in the order, excluding tax/tip.

members.name: pickupInfo
members.doc: Info for creating a pickup delivery. Can also be specified for drop-off orders, so that the deliverer knows where to pick up the order before dropping it off.

members.name: dropOffInfo
members.doc: Info for creating a drop-off delivery. Can also be specified for pickup orders, so that the deliverer knows where to drop off the order after picking it up.

members.name: contactlessDelivery
members.doc: If `true`, the delivery is a contactless delivery. This means that the order is placed outside the customer's door.

members.name: pickupTime
members.doc: The requested time at which the order should be picked up.

members.name: dropOffTime
members.doc: The requested time at which the order should be delivered.

members.name: deliveryId
members.doc: The delivery ID supplied by the local delivery service provider.

members.name: pickupWindowStartTime
members.doc: When a delivery is ready to be picked up. This is the start time of the pickup window.

members.name: pickupWindowEndTime
members.doc: When a delivery must be picked up by. This is the end time of the pickup window.

members.name: dropOffWindowStartTime
members.doc: When a delivery is ready to be dropped off. This is the start time of the drop-off window.

members.name: dropOffWindowEndTime
members.doc: When a delivery must be dropped off by. This is the end time of the drop-off window.

members.name: deliveryFee
members.doc: Amount to charge for this delivery.

members.name: catalogItemName
members.doc: Line item name as defined in the catalog.

members.name: catalogReference
members.doc: References to the line item’s origin catalog.

members.name: subtotal
members.doc: The subtotal for all items in the order, excluding tax/tip.

members.name: lineItems
members.doc: Dishes and options included in the order.

members.name: instructions
members.doc: Instructions for the courier at the drop-off location.

members.name: configurationId
members.doc: Unique identifier of the store, restaurant, or business location where the order can be picked up.

members.name: storeName
members.doc: The name of the location where the order should be picked up from.

members.name: phone
members.doc: Phone number of the store, restaurant, or business location where the order should be picked up from.

members.name: instructions
members.doc: Instructions for the courier at the pickup location.

members.name: deliveryId
members.doc: Used to reference the estimate when creating a new order.

members.name: deliveryFee
members.doc: Estimated amount to charge for this delivery.

docs.summary:
Possible values are:
  • NONE
  • READY
  • PENDING
  • ERROR
  • NOT_STARTED

Business Status. Possible values are:
  • NONE
  • READY
  • PENDING
  • ERROR
  • NOT_STARTED

Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN
  • CREATED
  • ACTIVE
  • INACTIVE
